Yes... YES!! The force is complete! Our numbers grow more by the second! But, something's off... I'll save [Triumph of the Hordes](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=218044) until we launch. Karona! Bring a few zombies into the perimeter. We need to test their reactions. Poke at them, test their defenses. See how well they offer resistance. I'll stay here and recycle [Mana Bloom](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=253592) to keep multiplying our numbers.

Attention all hands! At any time, be prepared for a force. I'm not sure what to call it, but the ones who invented it designate it as the "proto-ion field". It contains enough power to nullify even your most basic functionalities. If this happens, withdraw and cast [Golgari Charm](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=265385). I need to run on and seek out the [Grove of the Guardian](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=270968). Until I return, if you do indeed fall back, wait for my return. I seem to have resistance to the effects, so I'll go alone.

\*Alarms Blaze\*

We see a man at a terminal surrounded by monitors, he looks worried as he moves with superhuman speed attempting to control the situation. A large burly man stands behind him glaring impatiently.

"Well, can you do it or not?", the General Demands

"Yes... it will take five hours, but with the fires and the radiation, you are aware what will happen?"

"Well you have only THREE TURNS. We'll deal with the repercussions later, the first battalion has fallen due to some unknown pathogen and this new force, this FireFaced, managed a direct strike on our power infrastructure, even if it kills us all we have to risk it," the General boasts. (have to love those cliche tv lines)

The general turns to leave, "We will station two battalions here, any more and the enemy would notice something is amiss... we must not let this project fall into their hands."

The camera shifts, we're back with the teacher and the children, this time it's Timmy talking, and he's about to tell us what this secret project is all about.
**nukes land on everyone's hills**Ã¢â‚¬â€¹ All your base are belong to me!

Technology... The nuclear weapon, an artifact. Powerful for their time, but primitive now, and heavily manipulable. One stray ion in the forest, and the rebuttals will be quite severe...

I must not distract myself with trivial matters. He is not an ally. He is a danger to the forest that I must protect, and protect it I will.

\*We come back in, seemingly right after Timmy finished explaining the plan\*

"Your father did *what*?" The children exclaim.

"He managed to harness the power of Magic, with technology!", exclaimed Timmy; "He showed me last spring when he grew that enormous tree in our front yard"

"Timmy", The teacher asked timidly, "Was that around the time your mother... went missing", she hesitates on that last part, as if holding back something dire.

"Well yes", Timmy said sorrowfully, "my dad said she was scared of what he'd become and left, but she'll be back when he's the hero!"

"Yes, I'm sure she will", the teacher looks at the monitors showing the city outside, off in the distance she can see it, an old workshop with the tale-tell signs of magical energies emanating from it... and growing. There are somethings man was not meant to play with, she turns her attention back to the monitors, and thinking about the state little timmy's mother's body was in when she found her... there are some things man should not mettle in, and magic is one of them.

Get to it! Xannari needs our force to launch soon! We can't risk being struck before we can move!

Each minion restless, working hard to produce mana so they can follow orders, Karona in strict leadership, and Xannari heading towards the grove...

**\*------\***

Hmm? I feel a presence... it's definitely nearby, but where is it coming from? There shouldn't be any summoners in this place...

Xannari senses the presence of a summoner's force. It's in proximity to the confrontation distance, but there's not figure as to where it is. What could it be?

"Not enough, not enough", the madman looks at the stationed battalions. "It is not enough!"

"Extend the field, let it cover the city, do it and you can end the terror once and for all.... do it for Charlotte." A voice says inside his head.

"Yes", the madman says, "YES! Not the whole city, just the main bunkers... they're all in the bunkers now"

The general returns and the troops salute him; he shrugs it off as he whispers in the madman's ear, "are they enough?"

"Yes, they are, they will be... step in, step in"

The teacher watches in horror from the monitors as a tidal wave of magical energies erupts from the workshop, consuming everything in its path the buildings, the ground... the shelters she suddenly realized. Looking close she could see three people standing together. 

[A general](http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/william-f-halsey), [timmy's father](http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/rashek-the-lord-ruler), and a [strange cameo that has no relevance to the story what so ever.](http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/pilot)

She quickly turns off the monitors, and goes to comfort the children, fearing the demons that have just been unleashed.

(I have to say, this got dark pretty fast. Initially I was just planning on turning the field back on in 3 turns; but then the idea of a secret project sounded so much more alluring and what better way to counter magic but with magic? But then I realized that as a technological civilization, the magic should be perverse, not natural... and have dire consequences. Of course, the fake cards were just because I don't know how to play magic and I thought it'd show just how perverse the techno-magic really was.)

[Oh, we get to use custom cards now? Sweet!]

"[Sima](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=10630), give a tactical update."

"Well, we may have hit a few snags. We cannot produce anymore mana, and the counters from the bloom are running short. We'll be unable to grow to the ranks that Xannari requested by the time he returns. Though we can ask the [Crypt Ghast](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=389474) for assistance, our work will still be hindered by a... power." Being vague, aren't we?

"Power? What kind? What could be great enough to hinder this much work by this long?" You can feel the impatience growing.

"Our scouts report it feels the same as a summoners, but it is not Xannari. We cannot triangulate it's position."

"A summoner? That's impossible, this world does not thrive in the same ways as us. No magic should exist here. Have you given word to anyone else?"

"No, I've kept it limited to the senior members. I fear that telling the lower ranks may result in speculation, and that's the last thing we need."

"What if it is a summoner, though? What do we do? We can't just let it keep gaining power like this."

"I don't know, you're the commander right now, you tell me. But keep in mind that Xannari's wishes must be fulfilled in it's time."

"...No."

"Pardon?"

"If this is dealing with power on a summoner's level, then we can't ignore it. Tell the senior members that all other priorities have been receded. Pool the mana into Xannari's mana pool, and wait for me there."

"B-But it's not like you to disobey orders! Why do you go against our master's wishes? It's not your call to make! You can't just go against his orders like this!"

"You did say I am the commander, right? Now do what I say or I'll do it myself."

"...alright, you're the commander. I'll follow orders, but I still agree that you're making a mistake."

"[Srynia's](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-8SjYm79t9ww/VWZPt0mTAbI/AAAAAAAABDk/4SYdLgHovA8/w375-h523-no/Srynia.png) no mistake. Only she can contend with a summoner's power..."

The General feels revived, younger than he has felt in years, and the power... he targets zombie horde, unleashing a [terrifying flaming tornado](http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/flaming-tornado) while the madman went forth, [[http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/slavery-1\]convincing](http://mtgcardsmith.com/view/slavery-1%5Dconvincing) the survivors to do his bidding.

They smile and approach, unaware of the dark shadow that lay behind them.

(Honestly, I've kind of run out of juice, don't know what I'm doing right now or where this insanity is suppose to go)

Many owning. Wow hill. Very magic.

"No. No! Minions, what are you doing? Turn around and fight your enemy!" Karona's efforts to revert the mass are futile, yet she keeps trying.

"Come on! I'm your commander! I've trained you to resist such magnitudes of betrayal. Show me all that I've accomplished something!"

...But no dice.

"Yes. I sensed that you needed aid, so I came to you quickly."

"Thank you. You see, my army is under some sort of mental corruption. It's turning them against me, and themselves! Is there anything you can do to free them?"

"...No, although..."

"I can save you."

"What do you mean?"

"Go, [Withstand Death](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=209035)."

"What are you doing!?"

"Now! [Supreme Verdict](http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=253512)!"
